questions.question: What is the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: A direct neural connection between the brain and gut
The physical structure of the digestive system
A bidirectional communication system between the central nervous system, gastrointestinal tract, and gut microbiota
questions.answer: A bidirectional communication system between the central nervous system, gastrointestinal tract, and gut microbiota

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key player in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
questions.answer: Liver

questions.question: What is the primary neural connection between the gut and the brain?
questions.answer: Vagus nerve

questions.question: Which part of the brain is involved in regulating hunger and thirst?
questions.answer: Hypothalamus

questions.question: What is the enteric nervous system often called?
questions.answer: The second brain

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of microorganism found in the gut microbiota?
questions.answer: Protozoa

questions.question: What is the role of the gut-associated lymphoid tissue (GALT)?
questions.answer: To maintain immune homeostasis

questions.question: Which of the following is a microbial metabolite that can influence gut barrier function and inflammation?
questions.answer: Short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs)

questions.question: What is the primary function of the vagus nerve in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: To transmit signals between the brain and gut
To eliminate waste from the body
questions.answer: To transmit signals between the brain and gut

questions.question: Which hormone, produced in the gut, regulates appetite and mood?
questions.answer: Ghrelin

questions.question: What is the role of cytokines in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: They are signaling molecules in immune responses
questions.answer: They are signaling molecules in immune responses

questions.question: Which neurotransmitter, important for mood regulation, can be produced by gut bacteria?
questions.answer: Serotonin

questions.question: What is dysbiosis?
choices: An imbalance in the microbial community in the body
questions.answer: An imbalance in the microbial community in the body

questions.question: Which system plays a crucial role in the stress response and is influenced by gut microbiota?
questions.answer: Hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis

questions.question: What is the primary function of prebiotics?
choices: To directly add beneficial bacteria to the gut
To promote the growth of beneficial microorganisms in the gut
To kill harmful bacteria in the gut
questions.answer: To promote the growth of beneficial microorganisms in the gut

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of psychobiotics?
choices: Live microorganisms that may produce mental health benefits when ingested
Brain imaging techniques for studying gut function
questions.answer: Live microorganisms that may produce mental health benefits when ingested

questions.question: How does the brain influence the composition of gut microbiota?
choices: Through the release of digestive enzymes
By altering gut motility and secretion
questions.answer: By altering gut motility and secretion

questions.question: What role do enteroendocrine cells play in the gut?
questions.answer: They produce hormones and neurotransmitters

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way that the brain-gut-microbiota axis communicates?
questions.answer: Telepathic signals

questions.question: What is the potential impact of chronic stress on the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: It has no effect on the axis
It can alter gut function and microbial composition
It improves communication within the axis
questions.answer: It can alter gut function and microbial composition

questions.question: Which of the following conditions has NOT been linked to disruptions in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
questions.answer: Fractured bones

questions.question: How does diet influence the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: It has no impact on the axis
It shapes gut microbiota composition and influences overall axis function
questions.answer: It shapes gut microbiota composition and influences overall axis function

questions.question: What is the significance of the blood-brain barrier in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: It prevents all communication between the gut and brain
It allows unrestricted passage of all substances between the gut and brain
It selectively allows certain microbial metabolites to influence brain function
It only exists in the gut
questions.answer: It selectively allows certain microbial metabolites to influence brain function

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the function of the enteric nervous system?
choices: It controls gut motility and secretion
questions.answer: It controls gut motility and secretion

questions.question: What is the potential benefit of understanding the brain-gut-microbiota axis for mental health treatment?
choices: It has no relevance to mental health
It could lead to new dietary and probiotic interventions for mental health disorders
It only applies to digestive disorders
It eliminates the need for traditional psychiatric medications
questions.answer: It could lead to new dietary and probiotic interventions for mental health disorders

questions.question: How might traditional Timorese dietary practices potentially influence the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: They have no impact on the axis
They could influence gut microbiota composition and potentially affect mental health
questions.answer: They could influence gut microbiota composition and potentially affect mental health

questions.question: What is the role of tryptophan metabolites in the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: They are waste products with no function
They are precursors to serotonin, influencing mood regulation
They are harmful to gut bacteria
questions.answer: They are precursors to serotonin, influencing mood regulation

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of nutritional psychiatry?
choices: The use of psychiatric medications to treat nutritional deficiencies
The study of how nutrition impacts mental health through mechanisms like the brain-gut-microbiota axis
The practice of prescribing specific diets to treat all mental health disorders
The use of brain imaging to study digestive processes
questions.answer: The study of how nutrition impacts mental health through mechanisms like the brain-gut-microbiota axis

questions.question: What is the potential significance of fermented foods in the context of the brain-gut-microbiota axis?
choices: They have no impact on the axis
They are harmful to gut bacteria
They may provide beneficial probiotics and support a healthy gut microbiome
questions.answer: They may provide beneficial probiotics and support a healthy gut microbiome

questions.question: How might understanding the brain-gut-microbiota axis influence public health initiatives in Timor-Leste?
choices: It has no relevance to public health
It could lead to dietary recommendations and interventions to improve both physical and mental health
It only applies to treating digestive disorders
It eliminates the need for traditional medical treatments
